1: The first person God created was Adam. Adam's son was Seth. Seth's son was Enosh. Enosh's son was Kenan.
2: Kenan's son was Mahalalel. Mahalalel's son was Jared. Jared's son was Enoch.
3: Enoch's son was Methuselah. Methusalah's son was Lamech. Lamech's son was Noah.
4:
Noah's sons were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.\s2 These are the sons of Japheth.


\li1
5: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.\li2
6: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.\li2
7:
The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.\s2 These are the sons of Ham.


\li1
8: The sons of Ham were Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan.\li1
9:
The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteka.\li2 The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
\li1
10:
Another son of Cush was Nimrod. When he grew up, he became a mighty warrior on the earth.

\li1
11: Egypt was the ancestor of the Lud , the Anam, the Lehab, the Naphtuh,
12:
the Pathrus, the Kasluh, and the Caphtor people groups. The people of the region of Philistia were descended from the Kasluh people group.

\li1
13: Canaan's first son was Sidon. He was also the ancestor of the people groups of the Hethites,
14: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
15: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
16:
the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.\s2 These are the descendants of Shem


\li1
17:
The sons of Shem were Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.\li1 Aram's sons were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
\li1
18: Arphachshad was the father of Shelah, who was the father of Eber.\li2
19:
Eber had two sons. One was named Peleg which sounds like the word that means 'divided' because during the time that he lived, the people on the earth were divided into various language groups. Peleg's younger brother was Joktan.

\li2
20: Joktan was the ancestor of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
24: These are the descendants of Shem, in order from him to Abraham: Arphaxad, Shelah,
27:
and Abram, whose name was later changed to Abraham.\s2 These are the descendants of Abraham.


\li1
28: Abraham's sons were Isaac and Ishmael.\li1
29: The son of Abraham's slave wife Hagar was Ishmael. Ishmael's twelve sons were Nebaioth, his firstborn, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
32:
After Abraham's wife Sarah died, he took another wife named Keturah. Her sons were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.\li2 Jokshan's sons were Sheba and Dedan.
\li2
33:
Midian's sons were Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida, and Eldaah.\s2 These are the descendants of Esau.


\li1
34: The son of Abraham's wife Sarah was Isaac, and Isaac's sons were Esau and Jacob, whose name was later changed to Israel.\li1
35: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.\li2
36: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.\li2
37:
Reuel's sons were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.\s2 These are the descendants of Seir.


\li1
38: Another descendant of Esau was Seir. His descendants lived in the region of Edom. Seir's sons were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.\li2
39: Lotan's sons were Hori and Homam, and Lotan's sister was Timna.\li2
40:
Shobal's sons were Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.\li2 Zibeon's sons were Aiah and Anah.


\li2
41:
Anah's son was Dishon.\li2 1 Dishon's sons were Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.
\li2
42:
Ezer's sons were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.\li2 Dishan's sons were Uz and Aran.
\s2 These are the kings of Edom.
43:
These are the names of the kings who ruled the region of Edom before any kings ruled over Israel:\li1 Bela son of Beor, was king in Edom, and the name of the city in which he lived was Dinhabah.
\li1
44: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah, from the city of Bozrah, became the king.\li1
45:
When Jobab died, Husham became the king. He was from the region where the Teman people group lived.

\li1
46: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, became the king. He ruled in the city of Avith. Hadad's army defeated the army of the Midian people group in the region of Moab.\li1
47: When Hadad died, Samlah became the king. He was from the city of Masrekah.\li1
48:
When Samlah died, Shaul became the king. He was from the city of Rehoboth Hannahar.

\li1
49: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Akbor became the king.\li1
50: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadar became the king. He was from the city of Pau. His wife's name was Mehetabel; she was the daughter of Matred and the granddaughter of Me-Zahab.
51: Then Hadad died.\li1 The chiefs of the Edom people group were Chiefs Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
54: and Magdiel. These were the chiefs of Edom.
